timeline.bodyText:
Extract a variable containing
 Arrays.stream(ResourcesPlugin.getWorkspace().getRoot().getProjects())
before the for loop
This can be further optimized, but considering the size of the projects is small, I think it is ok for now.
timeline.author: sandupostaru

replies.bodyText: Good catch. But the solution is not good :) since "Consumed Stream pipelines should not be reused".
replies.author: minhtutonthat

timeline.author: sandupostaru

replies.bodyText: I think the code's logic is clearer when "we accept the /all argument" than "we check the input only it's different than /all"
replies.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText:
I think your opinion is influenced by the   // /all is accepted as argument  comment.
I bet that if you remove that comment and another guy just looks as an empty branch - he won't understand why the branch is empty 😕 .
It's up to you if you make the change or not, either way works for me 🙆‍♂️
replies.author: sandupostaru

timeline.bodyText: Question: Is it necessary to create the output folder as a project and not only as a folder using standard java API?
timeline.author: sandupostaru

replies.bodyText: I also think it's better to use a standard path but outputfolder has always been used by user as a relative folder in an Eclipse project. I thinks it was implemented to be coherent with the HTMLCommandLine (where you choose a folder in a project as output).
